nodes.documentation:
deposit ether for a contract.
This ether will be used to repay relay calls into this contract.
Contract owner should monitor the balance of his contract, and make sure
to deposit more, otherwise the contract won't be able to receive relayed calls.
Unused deposited can be withdrawn with `withdraw()`
nodes.name: depositFor

nodes.documentation:
withdraw funds.
caller is either a relay owner, withdrawing collected transaction fees.
or a RelayRecipient contract, withdrawing its deposit.
note that while everyone can `depositFor()` a contract, only
the contract itself can withdraw its funds.
nodes.name: withdraw
relay

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (bytes memory) pure returns (struct RelayHub.Transaction memory)
function (bytes memory) pure returns (struct RelayHub.Transaction memory)

nodes.documentation:
deposit ether for a contract.
This ether will be used to repay relay calls into this contract.
Contract owner should monitor the balance of his contract, and make sure
to deposit more, otherwise the contract won't be able to receive relayed calls.
Unused deposited can be withdrawn with `withdraw()`
nodes.name: depositFor

nodes.documentation:
withdraw funds.
caller is either a relay owner, withdrawing collected transaction fees.
or a RelayRecipient contract, withdrawing its deposit.
note that while everyone can `depositFor()` a contract, only
the contract itself can withdraw its funds.
nodes.name: withdraw
relay

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (bytes memory) pure returns (struct RelayHub.Transaction memory)
function (bytes memory) pure returns (struct RelayHub.Transaction memory)

params.gas_limit: limit the client want to put on its transaction
params.gas_price: gas price the client is willing to pay
params.transaction_fee: fee (%) the relay takes over actual gas cost.

depositFor(address).notice: deposit ether for a contract. This ether will be used to repay relay calls into this contract. Contract owner should monitor the balance of his contract, and make sure to deposit more, otherwise the contract won't be able to receive relayed calls. Unused deposited can be withdrawn with `withdraw()`

withdraw(uint256).notice: withdraw funds. caller is either a relay owner, withdrawing collected transaction fees. or a RelayRecipient contract, withdrawing its deposit. note that while everyone can `depositFor()` a contract, only the contract itself can withdraw its funds.
